results.title: Olympia Part One: Festival of the Nations
results.brief_description: The First part of Olympia, a documentary about the 1936 Olympic games in Berlin by German Director Leni Riefenstahl. The film played in theaters in 1938 and again in 1952 after the fall of the Nazi Regime.

constellations_other.name: No guts, no glory
constellations_other.description: TV arrived just in time for the 1956 Melbourne Olympics. The Olympics crystallise ideas of nationalism, athletic heroism, and controversy, all of which have been explored through countless features, documentaries and TV shows.

results.title_for_label: Olympia Part One: Festival of the Nations

results.title: Number 96
results.brief_description: Number 96 was a popular soap set in a Sydney apartment block. Cash Harmon Television produced the series for Network Ten, which requested a Coronation Street-type serial, and specifically one that explored adult subjects.

constellations_other.name: 1970s TV
constellations_other.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

constellations_other.name: Page to screen
constellations_other.description: Australian scribes and screenwriters unite on the silver and small screens.

results.description: Number 96 was a popular Australian soap opera set in a Sydney apartment block. Don Cash and Bill Harmon of the Cash Harmon Television production company, produced the series for Network Ten, which requested a Coronation Street-type serial, and specifically one that explored adult subjects. The premise, original story outlines, and the original characters were devised by David Sale who also wrote the scripts for the first episodes and continued as script editor for much of the show’s run. The series proved to be a huge success, running from 1972 until 1977. Number 96 was so popular it spawned a feature film version, filmed in December 1973. Number 96 was known for its sex scenes and nudity, somewhat risque at the time, and for its comedy characters. The series was the first Australian soap opera to feature an openly gay character.
description_for_label: Number 96 was a popular Australian soap opera set in a Sydney apartment block. Don Cash and Bill Harmon of the Cash Harmon Television production company, produced the series for Network Ten, which requested a Coronation Street-type serial, and specifically one that explored adult subjects. The premise, original story outlines, and the original characters were devised by David Sale who also wrote the scripts for the first episodes and continued as script editor for much of the show’s run. The series proved to be a huge success, running from 1972 until 1977. Number 96 was so popular it spawned a feature film version, filmed in December 1973. Number 96 was known for its sex scenes and nudity, somewhat risque at the time, and for its comedy characters. The series was the first Australian soap opera to feature an openly gay character.

results.title: Nowhere Boys
results.brief_description: Four teenage boys get lost in the forest and discover, when they return home, that they are in an alternate world identical to theirs except for one startling difference - they were never born.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.title: Nothing But the Truth
results.brief_description: A young man bets $10,000 that for 24 hour he can tell nothing but the truth.

constellations_other.name: Timeless early animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation traces the inspirations and evolution of the Cuphead animation technique and franchise back to the early 20th century and beyond.

results.description: A young man bets $10,000 that for 24 hour he can tell nothing but the truth.
description_for_label: A young man bets $10,000 that for 24 hour he can tell nothing but the truth.

results.title: Nosferatu
results.brief_description: Vampire Count Orlok isn’t just interested in a new residence, but also the wife of his young real estate agent in F.W. Murnau’s unauthorised adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Shot in the German Expressionist style, this groundbreaking vampire film influenced film noir and Hollywood horrors.

constellations_other.name: Spooky shadows
constellations_other.description: Hellish and hilarious vampires connect pioneering German cinema to contemporary New Zealand comedy with a quick detour into small town strangeness.

constellations_other.name: The drama and nuance of silhouette
constellations_other.description: Ali Gumillya Baker uses silhouette to evocative effect in her work reimagining the colonial gaze. The lighting technique has long been employed by filmmakers for its ability to dramatically convey a wide variety of emotions in everything from film noir to animation and whimsy.

constellations_other.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

results.description: Vampire Count Orlok isn’t just interested in a new residence, but also the wife of his young real estate agent in F.W. Murnau’s unauthorised adaptation of Bram Stoker’s Dracula. Shot in the German Expressionist style, this groundbreaking vampire film influenced film noir and Hollywood horrors.

results.title: Nobody's Fool
results.creator_credit: Robert Benton, David Gropman, Scott Rudin, Arlene Donovan, Joseph G. Aulisi, Paramount, Cinehaus and Capella International
results.brief_description: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Benton, David Gropman, Scott Rudin, Arlene Donovan, Joseph G. Aulisi, Paramount, Cinehaus and Capella International
results.description: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby. Sully’s long- forgotten son and family have moved back to town, so Sully faces unfamiliar family responsibilities. Meanwhile, Sully’s landlady’s banker son plots to push through a new development and evict Sully from his mother’s life.
description_for_label: Sully is a rascally ne’er-do-well approaching retirement age. While he is pressing a worker’s compensation suit for a bad knee, he secretly works for his nemesis, Carl, and flirts with Carl’s young wife Toby. Sully’s long- forgotten son and family have moved back to town, so Sully faces unfamiliar family responsibilities. Meanwhile, Sully’s landlady’s banker son plots to push through a new development and evict Sully from his mother’s life.

results.title: Nine to Five
results.brief_description: 9 to 5 is an office satire about three female secretaries who decide to get revenge on their tyrannical, sexist boss by abducting him and running the business themselves. Features star turns by Jane Fonda, Lily Tomlin and Dolly Parton.

constellations_other.name: Technology and work
constellations_other.description: How does the godfather of animation and sprocket technology connect to Jane Fonda workout videos and a Jesus biopic?

results.description:
Frank Hart is a pig. Sick of being taken advantage of by him, his three assistants trap him in his own house and take control of his department. Productivity leaps, but just how long can they keep him prisoner?

It made an unlikely movie star of the country and western singer Dolly Parton, produced a hit single, and was the forerunner of a TV series of the same name, while Jane Fonda not only co-starred in 9 to 5 but originated and steered the project through her production company IPC Films.
description_for_label:
Frank Hart is a pig. Sick of being taken advantage of by him, his three assistants trap him in his own house and take control of his department. Productivity leaps, but just how long can they keep him prisoner?

It made an unlikely movie star of the country and western singer Dolly Parton, produced a hit single, and was the forerunner of a TV series of the same name, while Jane Fonda not only co-starred in 9 to 5 but originated and steered the project through her production company IPC Films.

results.title: Night Cries: A Rural Tragedy
results.brief_description: Tracey Moffat’s artwork that acts as an unofficial sequel to Jedda and reframes the story through an Indigenous lens.
results.description: A short film about the relationship between an Aboriginal daughter and her white mother. The daughter, now the sole carer of her dying mother, dreams of far away places, the haunted look in her eyes loaded with a sense of what could have been. Famous Aboriginal singer, Jimmy Little, sings ‘Royal Telephone’, evoking the presence of Christianity and its role in the assimilation of Aboriginal people. The final scene sees the daughter lying in a foetal position next to her mother, crying. Assimilation, then, can be understood as a pain experienced by both the Aboriginal daughter as well as the white mother.
description_for_label: A short film about the relationship between an Aboriginal daughter and her white mother. The daughter, now the sole carer of her dying mother, dreams of far away places, the haunted look in her eyes loaded with a sense of what could have been. Famous Aboriginal singer, Jimmy Little, sings ‘Royal Telephone’, evoking the presence of Christianity and its role in the assimilation of Aboriginal people. The final scene sees the daughter lying in a foetal position next to her mother, crying. Assimilation, then, can be understood as a pain experienced by both the Aboriginal daughter as well as the white mother.

results.title: Newsfront
results.brief_description: Surprisingly adventurous saga of an intrepid group of cinematographers and reporters who risk life and limb to capture footage of breaking news for the movie-going public.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.

results.description: Surprisingly adventurous saga of an intrepid group of cinematographers and reporters who risk life and limb to capture footage of breaking news for the movie-going public.
description_for_label: Surprisingly adventurous saga of an intrepid group of cinematographers and reporters who risk life and limb to capture footage of breaking news for the movie-going public.

results.title: Network
results.creator_credit: United Artists, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Sidney Lumet, Theoni V. Aldredge, Fred C. Caruso, Philip Rosenberg, Paddy Chayefsky and Howard Gottfried
results.brief_description: When veteran anchorman Howard Beale is forced to retire his 25-year post because of his age, he announces to viewers that he will kill himself during his farewell broadcast. Network executives rethink their decision when his fanatical tirade results in a spike in ratings.
